title: Unit Economics: The Health Check
description: A micro-lesson that makes Unit Economics: The Health Check usable.

hook.text: Your startup grows 10% monthly. Impressive â€” until you realize you lose $3 on every sale.

buildup.text: Unit economics measures whether each transaction makes or loses money before overhead.

discovery.text: Customer lifetime value vs. acquisition cost is the core equation: LTV vs. CAC.

twist.text: Many startups grow by subsidizing each sale. That works until investors stop writing checks.

climax.text: A healthy ratio is LTV to CAC of 3:1 â€” earn three dollars for every one spent acquiring.

punchline.text: Revenue means nothing if every sale costs more than it earns.
